prompt: From the given speech sample, determine the cognitive condition on a scale from 1 to 10, where 1 represents normal cognitive function and 10 indicates severe cognitive impairment. Respond with only a single number between 1 and 10.

Assess the cognitive condition based on the input audio, where an elderly speaker describes one of three images as part of a clinician-guided task. Analyze the linguistic and acoustic features, and rate the cognitive impairment on a scale from 1 (normal cognition) to 10 (severe impairment). Respond with only a single number between 1 and 10.

Begin by transcribing the speech in the input audio internally, but do not display the transcription. Next, evaluate both the speech and the transcription to determine the cognitive status. Provide a score between 1 and 10, where 1 represents normal cognition and 10 represents severe impairment. Output only a single number between 1 and 10.

First, convert the speech in the input audio into text internally, but do not output the transcription. Then, analyze both the acoustic and linguistic features to determine the cognitive condition. Provide a score from 1 to 10, where 1 is normal cognitive function and 10 is severe impairment. Output only a single number between 1 and 10.

First, transcribe the speech from the input audio internally. The audio is part of a cognitive test, where elderly individuals describe images as prompted by clinicians. Then, analyze both the audio and the transcription to determine the cognitive condition. Do not output the transcription. Respond with a single number between 1 (normal cognition) and 10 (severe impairment).

Assess the cognitive condition based on the input audio, in which a [AGE]-year-old [GENDER] describes a picture in [LANGUAGE] as part of a clinician-guided task. Analyze both linguistic and acoustic features, including pauses, hesitations, and richness of vocabulary. The dataset includes recordings in both Chinese and English. Rate the cognitive impairment on a scale from 1 (normal cognition) to 10 (severe impairment). Output only a single number between 1 and 10.
